sen.j: 御名部皇女（みなべのひめみこ、皇極天皇6年（660年）? - 没年不詳）は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Minabe no himemiko (660-date of death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in Asuka period.
Minabe no himemiko (660-date of death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Asuka period.
Minabe no Himemiko (660 - year of death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 天智天皇の皇女で、母は蘇我倉山田石川麻呂の娘、姪娘。
sen.e: Her father was Emperor Tenchi, and her mother was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, Meinoiratsume.
Her father was Emperor Tenchi, and her mother was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, Meinoiratsume.
Her father was Emperor Tenchi, and her mother was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, Mei no Iratsume.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行を削除しました。

sen.e: She was an older maternal half-sister of Emperor Tenchi.
She was an older maternal half-sister of Emperor Tenchi.
She was an older maternal half-sister of Empress Genmei.

sen.j: 大宝律令施行後は御名部内親王とも記述される。
sen.e: After the enforcement of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), her name was also written as Imperial Princess Minabe.
After the enforcement of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), her name was also written as Imperial Princess Minabe.
After the enforcement of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), she was called as Imperial Princess Minabe.

sen.j: 高市皇子の正妃となり、長屋王を生む。
sen.e: She became a lawful wife of Takechi no Miko/Prince Takechi, and gave birth to Prince Nagaya.
She became a lawful wife of Takechi no Miko/Prince Takechi, and gave birth to Prince Nagaya.
She became a lawful wife of Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi), and gave birth to Nagaya-o (Prince Nagaya).

sen.j: 没年は未詳であるが、息子・長屋王が神亀5年（728年）に奉納したと言われる長屋王願経（神亀経）の釈文（写経の目的は父母の菩提を弔う、とする）から、神亀5年以前には亡くなっていたものと考えられる。
sen.e: Although the year of death was unknown, from the transliterated text of handwritten sutra of Prince Nagaya (the Jinki sutra) that was believed to be dedicated by her son, Prince Nagaya, in 728 (because the purpose of copying of a sutra is to pray to Buddha for the happiness of their parents' soul), it is considered that she died before 728.

Although the year of death was unknown, from the transliterated text of handwritten sutra of Prince Nagaya (the Jinki sutra) that was believed to be dedicated by her son, Prince Nagaya, in 728 (because the purpose of copying of a sutra is to pray to Buddha for the happiness of their parents' soul), it is considered that she died before 728.

Although the year of her death was unknown, according to Nagaya-o gankyo (the transliterated text of handwritten sutra of Nagaya-o [also known as the Jinki sutra]) that was believed her son, Nagaya-o dedicated in 728 (to hold a memorial service of his parents), it is considered that she died before 728.

sen.j: 中継ぎとして即位した妹・元明天皇を激励する歌が万葉集にある。
sen.e: The poem written by Minabe no himemiko to encouragement her sister, Empress Genmei, who ascended the throne as an relay successor, is contained in Manyo-shu.
The poem written by Minabe no himemiko to encourage her sister, Empress Genmei, who ascended the throne as a relay successor, is contained in Manyo-shu.
The poem written by Minabe no Himemiko to encourage her younger sister, Empress Genmei, who ascended the throne as a relay successor, is contained in Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).

sen.j: 御名部皇女に関する歌
sen.e: Poems related to Minabe no himemiko
Poems related to Minabe no himemiko
Poems related to Minabe no Himemiko

sen.j: 和銅元年 元明天皇の御製
sen.e: 708: The poem written by Empress Genmei.
708: The poem written by Empress Genmei.
708: The poem written by Empress Genmei
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 大夫（ますらを）の鞆（とも）の音すなり物部（もののふ）の 大臣（おほまへつきみ）楯立つらしも 万葉集 巻1-76
sen.e: I can hear the sound of brave men's Tomo (archers' wrist protector wore on the left hand), and I wonder if Minister of Mononobe might take up the shield. (Manyo-shu, Vol.1-76)
I can hear the sound of brave men's Tomo (archers' wrist protector wore on the left hand), and I wonder if Minister of Mononobe might take up the shield. (Manyo-shu, Vol.1-76)
I can hear the sound of brave men's Tomo (archers' wrist protector wore on the left hand), and I wonder if Minister of Mononobe might take up the shield; Manyoshu, Vol.1-76

sen.j: 御名部皇女の和（こた）へ奉れる御歌
sen.e: The poem replied by Minabe no himemiko to Empress Genmei
The poem replied by Minabe no himemiko to Empress Genmei
The poem replied by Minabe no Himemiko to Empress Genmei

sen.j: 吾が大君ものな思ほし皇神の 継ぎて賜へる我なけなくに 万葉集 巻1-77
sen.e: The Empress, I serve you, you have nothing to worry about, because next to you, I was sent to you by Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) and I am always with you. (Manyo-shu, Vo.1-77)
The Empress, I serve you, you have nothing to worry about, because next to you, I was sent to you by Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) and I am always with you. (Manyo-shu, Vo.1-77)
The Empress, I serve you, you have nothing to worry about, because next to you, I was sent to you by Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) and I am always with you; Manyoshu, Vo.1-77
